result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billy L Croon

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on January 27, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on September 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:04 PM cases 21CF560, 22CF821, 22CF824 called. Prosecuting attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Billy L Croon appeared by video.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Billy L Croon. Parties agree to postpone holding the motion hearing due to new discovery the State needs to provide to the Defense. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
In 22CF821 and 22CF824: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 
Defense asks for a reduction in the cash posted throughout the three cases. 
State objects to the cash bond reduction with argument and asks court to deny the request. 
Defense responds and renews their request to reduce the cash bond. 
State explains the bond in 21CF560. 
Court denies the Defense's request to reduce the bond amount in any of the files. 
State to respond to the Defense's motion by 9/23/22 in writing if they choose to do so. 
A motion hearing is scheduled for 9/30/22 at 2:30 pm
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward

(4:37 PM cases 22CF821, 22CF824 called.) Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Billy L Croon in court. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Billy L Croon.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in cases 22CF821, 22CF824 and Court accepts waivers.
State requests the cases be scheduled to ride along with case 21CF560 which is scheduled for a Motion Hearing in Branch 2 on 08/05/2022 at 3 pm.
Arraignment in cases 22CF821, 22CF824 scheduled for 08/05/2022 at 3 pm in Branch 2.

Conditions: 
No contact with J.T., Steamatic, B.C.
(Covers 22CF821, 22CF824)

(Cases 22CF821, 22CF824 are called at 11:18 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Billy Croon appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Katherine Cook. ADA Monica Fallon appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaints in 22CF821, 22CF824. Defendant updates phone number and is eligible for Public Defender representation. State requests $2,500 cash bond to cover both cases. Defense requests signature bond. Court orders $2,500 cash bond with various conditions. 
Court notes that at 11:22 AM the Defendant throws paperwork and walks off screen. 
Preliminary Hearing in both cases: 08/02/2022 at 2:30 PM.
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Conditions: 
No contact with J.T., Steamatic, B.C.
(Covers 22CF821, 22CF824)
